p: Hormones were extracted from plasma obtained from trunk blood using an ether extraction. T levels were determined using a radioimmunoassay following procedures described in Wingfield and Farner [ 59]. Average recovery was 92.9% (Â± 0.02 SE) and the intra-assay coefficient of variation was 3.2%. A t-test was used to determine if plasma T levels were affected by prenatal treatment. No random effect was included because no individuals were related.
